intro: Dysophylla erecta, commonly known as the upright dysophylla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Dysophylla erecta is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
